result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin M Brooks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.  Court authorizes transfer to county jail convenient to employment or residence.

miscConds.notes:
Bond amount posted shall be applied.  If probation or extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.
Defendant shall have no violent contact with the victim-Katlyn M.
Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with treatment recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.  Court authorizes transfer to county jail convenient to employment or residence.
Consecutive to: Count 2

miscConds.notes: All conditions of Count 2 are inclusive of Count 3.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin M Brooks

Disposition Form

Def in person & by Atty Christopher J. Cherella.  Atty Mark David Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  (Manitowoc Co. 16CF704; 16TR3358; 16TR3132) Victim Katlyn M. also appears.  Guilty plea entered to Count 2 and Count 3.  Court dismissed Count 1, Count 4, Count 5 and Count 6 for read-in.  Court finds def guilty on Count 2 and Count 3 and enters judgment.  Victim Katlyn M. makes statements.

ADDRESS INFO for Justin M Brooks
Current: 1422 Ontario Ave Upper, Sheboygan, WI 53081   (Effective: 01-04-2017)
Prior: 1422 Ontario Ave, Sheboygan, WI 53081

Hearing reset from 12-22-16 to January 4, 2017 at 02:30 pm. due to calendar conflict by counsel, anticipate proceeding to plea/sentencing.  Defendant has picked up new charges in Manitowoc County, 16CF704, 16TR3132 and 16TR3218.
No violent contact with KM
Hearing on December 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Def in person & by Atty Christopher J. Cherella.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Counsel request adjournment for further pretrial and to obtain counseling information.  Not guilty plea entered by the court.  Victim also appears and request to change the no contact provision, Court does not further review.  Atty. Cherella informs on defendant's treatment/counseling appointments and does not believe that the State would oppose the bond modification and parties have child in common.  Victim Katelyn M. renews request to have no contact be lifted.  Further statements by Atty. Cherella.  State does not object to bond modification to no violent contact with the victim.   Court grants bond modification to reflect no violent contact.  Hearing scheduled for December 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing on November 2, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Def in person & by Atty Christopher J. Cherella.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper and Megan Kaldunski appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Counsel's first appearance. Victim also appears and request bond modification to lift the no contact condition.  Court denies bond modification.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 2, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on September 26, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Def appeared in person.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Defendant has not retained counsel and request another month or two to save up for an attorney and has spoken with a few attorneys and has been working every day and has provided for his child and request additional time.  State does not oppose adjournment but does have concern that there has not been progress.  Court grants one adjournment.  Victim K.M.M. request bond modification. Defendant has not undergone any counseling.  State has some concerns on bond modification.  Court denies bond modification.  Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Letter received from KM
Amended; Victim requests to be present for court hearings
Bond received at Sheriff's Department per Receipt #112331 on 7/15/16; COC Rec#16R 014577 dated 7/21/16
No contact with K.M. except through a 3rd party for visitation of child
Victim does not request to be present for hearings
Hearing on August 17, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Evan Thomas Bins Nordgren.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Case recalled at 1:34 p.m.  Defendant is not SPD eligible.  Defendant request time to retain an attorney.  Counsel request a lower cash bond or a signature bond.  State does not oppose a slight reduction in the cash bond.  Court orders cash bond reduced to $500.00 cash bond.  Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Hearing on July 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Def appears in person in custody.  Atty Mark David Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Defendant did not talk to anyone from the SPD as unable to make a phone call.  SPD will have someone talk to him and case to be recalled this p.m.  Hearing scheduled for July 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
No contact with K.M. except through a 3rd party for visitation of child
Hearing on July 15, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Def appears in person in custody.  Atty Mark David Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant turned himself in.  State request $1,000-1,500.00 cash bond.  Defendant became a father in May and when saw child over the weekend turned himself in.  Court orders $1,000.00 cash bond.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  (SPD slip provided)  Defendant request a signature bond and makes statements for request.  Court maintains cash bond and will revisit at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 15, 2016 at 09:45 am.
in custody
Note received from district attorney's office
